com.argox.sdk.barcodeprinter.emulation.pplz

Class PPLZ_TextUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.argox.sdk.barcodeprinter.emulation.pplz.PPLZ_TextUtil

  • public class PPLZ_TextUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides methods for text-related programs of the PPLZ emulator. This class is used in PPLZ class.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PPLZ_TextUtil(PPLZ emulation)
      This is the constructor.

    • Method Detail

      • printText

        public final void printText(int x,
                            int y,
                            PPLZOrient orient,
                            PPLZFont font,
                            int width,
                            int height,
                            byte[] data,
                            int increase)
                     throws BarcodePrinterIllegalArgumentException,
                            BarcodePrinterGeneralException
        This function is used to print the string with internal font of the printer.
        Parameters:
        x - [in] X-axis coordinate. Range: 0~32000; unit: pixels.
        y - [in] Y-axis coordinate. Range: 0~32000; unit: pixels.
        orient - [in] Print orientation. Use PPLZOrient enum to set up.
        font - [in] Select font. The two types are bitmap font and scalable font; Use PPLZFont enum to set up.
        width -

        [in] Character width. Range: bitmap font to be 1~10 times of the original font (please refer to PPLZFont).

        Scalable font. Range: 10~32000; unit: pixels.

        height -

        [in] Character length. Range: bitmap font to be 1~10 times of the original font (please refer to PPLZFont).

        Scalable font. Range: 10~32000; unit: pixels.

        data - [in] String to print. Data type: byte array.
        increase - [in] Increment or decrement. If there is a "Serial Number" to be printed, the barcode information will be changed according to the value change of Serial Number, with 0~9 loop for numbers, and A~Z or a~z loop for alphabets.
        Throws:
        BarcodePrinterIllegalArgumentException - Invalid parameter or parameter is out of the valid range.
        BarcodePrinterGeneralException - General error, byte array operation error.
        See Also:
        PPLZOrient, PPLZFont

      • storeTextGraphic

        public final void storeTextGraphic(android.graphics.Typeface fontType,
                                   int fontsize,
                                   boolean useBold,
                                   boolean useItalic,
                                   boolean useUnderline,
                                   boolean useStrikeout,
                                   PPLZStorage storageType,
                                   java.lang.String imagename,
                                   java.lang.String data)
                            throws BarcodePrinterIllegalArgumentException,
                                   BarcodePrinterGeneralException
        This function is used to download the text graphic converted from the system font, and store the graphic into the printer.
        Parameters:
        fontType - [in] Font name of the system. Data type: Unicode.
        fontsize - [in] Font size. Range: >= 0.
        useBold - [in] Use of bold text. 'true' is to use; 'false' is not to use.
        useItalic - [in] Use of italic text. 'true' is to use; 'false' is not to use.
        useUnderline - [in] Use of underlined text. 'true' is to use; 'false' is not to use.
        useStrikeout - [in] Use of strikethrough text. 'true' is to use; 'false' is not to use.
        storageType - [in] Location of storage device. Use PPLZStorage enum to set up.
        imagename - [in] The graphic name to save. Range: 1~8 alphanumeric (alphabets or numbers) characters.
        data - [in] The string to convert into graphic file, cannot be empty string. Data type: Unicode.
        Throws:
        BarcodePrinterIllegalArgumentException - Invalid parameter or parameter is out of the valid range.
        BarcodePrinterGeneralException - General error, byte array operation error, or generating graphic data failed.

        This function only save the graphic data, and store the content into the printer's storage device. If need to print, please call PPLZ_GraphicsUtil.printStoreGraphic.

        As Flash memory has a limited access lifespan, unless graphic data is to be repeatedly used, it is recommended to store the graphic in DRAM.

        See Also:
        PPLZStorage, PPLZ_GraphicsUtil.printStoreGraphic(int, int, com.argox.sdk.barcodeprinter.emulation.pplz.PPLZStorage, java.lang.String, int, int)

      • storeTextGraphic

        public final void storeTextGraphic(android.graphics.Typeface fontType,
                                   int fontsize,
                                   boolean useBold,
                                   boolean useItalic,
                                   boolean useUnderline,
                                   boolean useStrikeout,
                                   PPLZStorage storageType,
                                   java.lang.String imagename,
                                   java.lang.String data,
                                   PPLZDataFormat formatType)
                            throws BarcodePrinterIllegalArgumentException,
                                   BarcodePrinterGeneralException
        This function is used to download the text graphic converted from the system font, and store the graphic into the printer.
        Parameters:
        fontType - [in] Font name of the system. Data type: Unicode.
        fontsize - [in] Font size. Range: >= 0.
        useBold - [in] Use of bold text. 'true' is to use; 'false' is not to use.
        useItalic - [in] Use of italic text. 'true' is to use; 'false' is not to use.
        useUnderline - [in] Use of underlined text. 'true' is to use; 'false' is not to use.
        useStrikeout - [in] Use of strikethrough text. 'true' is to use; 'false' is not to use.
        storageType - [in] Location of storage device. Use PPLZStorage enum to set up.
        imagename - [in] The graphic name to save. Range: 1~8 alphanumeric (alphabets or numbers) characters.
        data - [in] The string to convert into graphic file, cannot be empty string. Data type: Unicode.
        formatType - [in] The data format of the stored object. Use PPLZDataFormat enum to set up.
        Throws:
        BarcodePrinterIllegalArgumentException - Invalid parameter or parameter is out of the valid range.
        BarcodePrinterGeneralException - General error, byte array operation error, or generating graphic data failed.

        This function only save the graphic data, and store the content into the printer's storage device. If need to print, please call PPLZ_GraphicsUtil.printStoreGraphic.

        As Flash memory has a limited access lifespan, unless graphic data is to be repeatedly used, it is recommended to store the graphic in DRAM.

        See Also:
        PPLZStorage, PPLZ_GraphicsUtil.printStoreGraphic(int, int, com.argox.sdk.barcodeprinter.emulation.pplz.PPLZStorage, java.lang.String, int, int), PPLZDataFormat

      • storeTextGraphic

        public final void storeTextGraphic(android.graphics.Typeface fontType,
                                   int fontsize,
                                   boolean useBold,
                                   boolean useItalic,
                                   boolean useUnderline,
                                   boolean useStrikeout,
                                   PPLZStorage storageType,
                                   java.lang.String imagename,
                                   java.lang.String data,
                                   PPLZDataFormat formatType,
                                   PPLZOrient orient,
                                   int width)
                            throws BarcodePrinterIllegalArgumentException,
                                   BarcodePrinterGeneralException
        This function is used to download the text graphic converted from the system font, and store the graphic into the printer.
        Parameters:
        fontType - [in] Font name of the system. Data type: Unicode.
        fontsize - [in] Font size. Range: >= 0.
        useBold - [in] Use of bold text. 'true' is to use; 'false' is not to use.
        useItalic - [in] Use of italic text. 'true' is to use; 'false' is not to use.
        useUnderline - [in] Use of underlined text. 'true' is to use; 'false' is not to use.
        useStrikeout - [in] Use of strikethrough text. 'true' is to use; 'false' is not to use.
        storageType - [in] Location of storage device. Use PPLZStorage enum to set up.
        imagename - [in] The graphic name to save. Range: 1~8 alphanumeric (alphabets or numbers) characters.
        data - [in] The string to convert into graphic file, cannot be empty string. Data type: Unicode.
        formatType - [in] The data format of the stored object. Use PPLZDataFormat enum to set up.
        orient - [in] Print orientation. Use PPLZOrient enum to set up.
        width - [in] User-defined width. Range: >= 0; 0 means the system automatically calculates the width.
        Throws:
        BarcodePrinterIllegalArgumentException - Invalid parameter or parameter is out of the valid range.
        BarcodePrinterGeneralException - General error, byte array operation error, or generating graphic data failed.

        This function only save the graphic data, and store the content into the printer's storage device. If need to print, please call PPLZ_GraphicsUtil.printStoreGraphic.

        As Flash memory has a limited access lifespan, unless graphic data is to be repeatedly used, it is recommended to store the graphic in DRAM.

        See Also:
        PPLZStorage, PPLZ_GraphicsUtil.printStoreGraphic(int, int, com.argox.sdk.barcodeprinter.emulation.pplz.PPLZStorage, java.lang.String, int, int), PPLZDataFormat, PPLZOrient

      • printTextGraphic

        public final void printTextGraphic(int x,
                                   int y,
                                   android.graphics.Typeface fontType,
                                   int fontsize,
                                   boolean useBold,
                                   boolean useItalic,
                                   boolean useUnderline,
                                   boolean useStrikeout,
                                   java.lang.String data,
                                   PPLZDataFormat formatType,
                                   PPLZOrient orient,
                                   int width)
                            throws BarcodePrinterIllegalArgumentException,
                                   BarcodePrinterGeneralException
        This function is used to directly print text graphics converted using system fonts.
        Parameters:
        x - [in] X-axis coordinate. Range: 0~32000; unit: pixels.
        y - [in] Y-axis coordinate. Range: 0~32000; unit: pixels.
        fontType - [in] Font name of the system. Data type: Unicode.
        fontsize - [in] Font size. Range: >= 0.
        useBold - [in] Use of bold text. 'true' is to use; 'false' is not to use.
        useItalic - [in] Use of italic text. 'true' is to use; 'false' is not to use.
        useUnderline - [in] Use of underlined text. 'true' is to use; 'false' is not to use.
        useStrikeout - [in] Use of strikethrough text. 'true' is to use; 'false' is not to use.
        data - [in] The string to convert into graphic file, cannot be empty string. Data type: Unicode.
        formatType - [in] The data format of the stored object. Use PPLZDataFormat enum to set up.
        orient - [in] Print orientation. Use PPLZOrient enum to set up.
        width - [in] User-defined width. Range: >= 0; 0 means the system automatically calculates the width.
        Throws:
        BarcodePrinterIllegalArgumentException - Invalid parameter or parameter is out of the valid range.
        BarcodePrinterGeneralException - General error, byte array operation error, or generating graphic data failed.
        See Also:
        PPLZDataFormat, PPLZOrient
